intro: Petroselinum romanum, commonly known as parsley, is a biennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its hollow stems and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant has finely divided, aromatic leaves that are widely used in cooking and traditional medicine. Its seeds, known as parsley seeds, are also used in culinary and medicinal applications. Petroselinum romanum thrives in cool climates and well-drained soil, making it a popular garden plant.
